meanings.definition: Achalasias: a condition in which the muscles of the lower esophagus fail to relax, preventing food from passing into the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with achalasias after observing the symptoms.
meanings.sent2: Achalasias can cause discomfort and difficulty in swallowing.
meanings.sent3: When the lower esophagus muscles decided to go on strike, it resulted in achalasias.
meanings.sent4: Her achalasias were like a stubborn gate refusing to open for the food.
meanings.sent5: The image of achalasias blocking the path of food stuck in his mind.
